intro: Ampelocissus costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican grape vine, is a climbing plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils that help it climb supports. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible berries that are often consumed by wildlife. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and vine-like. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories.
